syllabus:
**I. COURSE OVERVIEW**

The main purpose of this course is to expand students’ abilities to read, reflect and discuss various cultural and global topics. No textbook is required. All reading materials will come from reliable sources such as The New York Times. Students are expected to read prior to the class and participate in class discussions.

**II. GRADING**

          Attendance 20%

l  If you have to miss a class, please email me in advance.

l  If you miss the class for more than 3 times (unexcused), points will be deducted.

          In-Class Participation 30%

l  You will work in pairs and with your group. Be a responsible partner. Finish reading before class, and be prepared to share your ideas.

l  Class activities

          Group Presentation 20%

l   Group presentation: Present a food related issue/ report. 12-15 minutes

l   Class activities.

Reading Journal 20%

l   Submit one reading journal for each theme. Typed/ Hand-written, double-spaced, hard copy, no more than 1 piece of paper.

l   Each journal should include:

a. Summary of one article (Pick one to write)

b. One discussion question and its answers (based on your group discussion)

c. Any other reading notes that you want to include in this theme (e.g. vocabulary, phrases, quotes, reflection…)

          Final Presentation 10%

l  Present a mind map or an infograph to illustrate what you have learned from this course.

l  2.5 minutes
